page.title: 17Changes in Durris
page.content: There have been quite a few changes round here in the past twenty five years or so,although the landscape itself has not altered much. Agriculture,which is still important, has changed because of the ammount of machines that are now used.There are fewer farmworkers now,and crops like oil seed rape have replaced others. Many more people travel to work in Aberdeen,partly because of the oil boom,and it has also meant more houses being built,and new people moving in.The old estate house has been made into flats.Transport has changed too.There are hardly any buses,and the Deeside railway has closed.Everybody relies on the car now.This in turn has led to the closure of the two local shops,but the school has more pupils now and has had an extension built on to it.
